\translation{hɔ̃/tha Sherbro submarine made of two canoes, one inverted upside down on top of the other. Fixed together in such a way that the seal is waterproof and dressed with the skin of a manatee (lamantin). At the head of this double canoe is an opening which can be closed. The submarine is moved by short oars. It is said that the kunkbɛ has sometimes the appearance of a crocodile. The cannibal alligator society uses them to approach children or women on the riverside and kidnap them. Inside the boat is a big stone that can be moved to regulate the equilibrium. \translation{They were learning Bolom.}%
\examplenumber{2}%

\translation{Some people they will hate you.}%
\examplenumber{4}%

\translation{Our brothers are all there; they have turned against us.}%
\examplenumber{5}%

\translation{They would have to hear it, that is why we are asking for your permission.}%
